subject: Re: Blanket Announcement:  I've posted files.  ;-)
author: itcdeadpeople
full_text:
Thank you, Misty.  It's always amazing to me that those in spirit can use such a wide 
variety of methods to communicate with us.  

Quick question... what am I doing wrong that causes the text in my posts not to wrap 
around properly?  (if that's the correct terminology)  

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Misty Dawn <bulletbabea@...> wrote:
>
> Thanks Margaret everyone appreciates this. I did get a chance today to go thru your 
files. I can hear all of the minibox, sweep, crowd babble, exactly as you do, the SJ method 
I hear some words as you do and some a bit different. I love the pictures, Ive visited your 
site before you joined here and have gone thru the gallery. It's quite impressive and 
interesting. Many remind me of what I have recieved using simliar methods.
>    
>   Great stuff!
>   Misty
> 
> itcdeadpeople <ITCdeadpeople@...> wrote:
>           Rather than generating a gazillion separate notifications, I figured I would do this 
one single 
> announcement stating that I have posted a couple examples in each of my subfolders. 
There 
> are two different types of ITC, and various EVP (MiniBox, manual radio sweep, 
traditional, 
> Portuguese crowd babble, etc.) The files are pretty small, so I'm not hogging up a lot 
space.
> 
> I always enjoy listening to and seeing other people's examples. I'm hoping others might 
> enjoy some of my examples as well, especially my water video ITC results (which as far 
as I 
> know, I was the first to come up with this technique). Other people have tried it and 
gotten 
> really good results, so if you're looking for something new and fun to try, please give it 
a 
> whirl. 
> 
> I really appreciate all the inspiration I've gotten from others. I'm trying to give back a 
little. 
> 
> :0) Margaret
> 
> 
> 
>                            
> 
>        
> ---------------------------------
> Never miss a thing.   Make Yahoo your homepage.
>
